definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
Red Devils, nickname of Manchester United Football Club
Devil's Island, notorious French prison off the coast of French Guyana

sentences.english: As the saying goes, the devil often appears in the subtle.
sentences.chinese: 俗话说，魔鬼常出现在细微处。

sentences.english: He is a handsome man with devilish charm.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个英俊潇洒有着魔鬼般魅力的男人。

sentences.english: Don't let the devil convince you otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 不要让魔鬼用别的方式说服你。

sentences.english: The cartoon represented the president as a devil.
sentences.chinese: 这幅漫画把总统画成了魔鬼。

sentences.english: The demon let out a muffled gargle.
sentences.chinese: 这个魔鬼发出沉闷的漱口的声音。

sentences.english: Take the horse and the cart, you devil, only don't take my life.
sentences.chinese: 马和车都归你，你个魔鬼，只要留下我的命。

sentences.english: Use hard-boiled eggs to make deviled eggs or egg salad sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 吃魔鬼蛋或者鸡蛋沙拉三明治的话要用全熟鸡蛋。

sentences.english: Open not your door when the devil knock.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼敲门慎莫开，开门必有灾祸来。

sentences.english: When seeing people, I happened to recognized them as devils with masks of human-beings.
sentences.chinese: 见人就如见了带了面具的魔鬼。

sentences.english: Devil often presents itself a friendly disguise in front of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼常以一种可亲的姿态出现在人类面前。

sentences.english: The Gospel is clear on that, too. Woe to you on whom the evil demons act.
sentences.chinese: 福音书上很清楚，对那些被魔鬼附身的表述悲哀吧。

sentences.english: Atlas is a false Greek god type of the devil.
sentences.chinese: 擎天神是魔鬼的一个希腊假神类的神祗。

sentences.english: It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
sentences.chinese: 天使或魔鬼，天堂或地域都无法从你这里夺走它。

sentences.english: Then she left the cow to the care of a hundred eyed monster, Argus.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉便将牛犊托付给百眼魔鬼阿刚斯看管。

sentences.english: The devil is not so black as he is painted.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼并非如描绘啲那样黒。

definition: to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
mythological figure (such as the Grim Reaper) in charge of taking the souls of those who die/(fig.) death
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
